I'd just like to interject for a moment. What you're referring to as Linux, is in fact, GNU/Linux, or as I've recently taken to calling it, GNU plus Linux. Linux is not an operating system unto itself, but rather another free component of a fully functioning GNU system made useful by the GNU corelibs, shell utilities and vital system components comprising a full OS as defined by POSIX.

Many computer users run a modified version of the GNU system every day, without realizing it. Through a peculiar turn of events, the version of GNU which is widely used today is often called "Linux", and many of its users are not aware that it is basically the GNU system, developed by the GNU Project.

There really is a Linux, and these people are using it, but it is just a part of the system they use. Linux is the kernel: the program in the system that allocates the machine's resources to the other programs that you run. The kernel is an essential part of an operating system, but useless by itself; it can only function in the context of a complete operating system. Linux is normally used in combination with the GNU operating system: the whole system is basically GNU with Linux added, or GNU/Linux. All the so-called "Linux" distributions are really distributions of GNU/Linux.

It should be noted that I have an IQ at the 100th percentile at 15 years old. While I know from my Advanced Placement Statistics class that this is not possible, I know from my Advanced Placement Computer Science class that the likely explanation is that the number was rounded because my integer IQ value score had reached MAX_INT.

It should be noted that I consider myself an inventor and free-thinker; even when I was very young I used to plan out the most elaborate inventions in my mind, and never accepted the tripe that the teachers, or even my parents, good-hearted as they were, laid onto me. My parents knew I was something special -- they always told me so, after all, but they never did financially support my endeavors to construct some of the incredible contraptions that arose from my mind. It's one of the things that made me realize that nobody could see the "big picture" like I could -- and nobody could see the details like I could either.

It should be noted that I know that I am very mature for my age. Most others are so concerned with those of their preferred gender and what they think about them. They engage in such stupid activites that end up damaging themselves and those around them, mentally, spiritually, and emotionally. I'm a big contributor to the brony community here on Reddit and DeviantART and many people have lauded me for my works.

It should be noted that even though I've just used the word spiritually, I'm no big proponent of religion. I believe that everyone should be able to believe what they want to, as long as their beliefs do not harm others. I truly respect the Buddhist and Sikh faiths, but reject the Islamic dogma. It's funny how they claim to be a religion of peace and then they kill people and the people of the religion as a whole do not try to distance themselves from those whom they label 'extremists'.

It should be noted that I'm also a pacifist -- something which separates me from the rest in my high school; something that I'm probably best known for over there. One time, somebody called me a "pony-loving faggot," and punched me in the face, breaking my nose. By the way, I strongly support his right to free speech and think that the word 'faggot' can be humorous if we do not let it have an effect on us. Anyway, I have an extreme tolerance to pain, and I didn't want to hurt him too badly if I didn't have to, so I faked tears, crying, shitting my pants, and vomiting to defuse the situation in a tactical manner.

It should be noted that the spectacle of my tolerance to pain and indifference to physical damage seems to have made all of the girls at my school attracted to me. They seem to be very intimidated by my presence; they always make weird looks at me and try to avoid me. However, I have watched a lot of anime, giving me some insight into a far more civilized and advanced foreign culture. I know from watching anime and old films that being mysterious and debonair and reserved impresses women, so I've begun to take up more antiquated and verbose speech, and refer to my classmates only by 'Mister' or 'Miss' and their last name. I also have begun to wear a suit and tie to class, and bring my work in a briefcase. I can see it working; everybody seems to be intimidated/attracted by/to me now; everybody seems hesitant to talk to me.
